title: Gerwyn Price admits pressure got to him in Michael van Gerwen Champions League loss
text:
Gerwyn Price suffered a heartbreaking loss to Michael van Gerwen on Sunday night (Picture: Getty Images)

Gerwyn Price lost out in a classic Champions League of Darts semi-final to Michael van Gerwen on Sunday night and admitted that the pressure got to him on the big stage.

Van Gerwen edged the superb encounter 11-10, needing an average of 105.54 to beat Price, who ended on 102.49 in a tremendous losing effort.

The Iceman has still never beaten the world number one in any competition, now going 18 matches without picking up a victory over MVG, with one Premier League draw the only piece of success for the world number five.

Price admitted to be hugely disappointed with yet another loss to the Dutchman, but was bullish that he will be back and picking up more wins in major events in the near future.

Michael van Gerwen has the Indian sign over Price (Picture: Getty Images)

‘I thought I played pretty well, I dominated most of that game, Michael played really well, we both did,’ Price told the BBC after the narrow loss.

‘Stages in that game I thought I was in control but same as always happens, I messed up that last leg, I probably should have beat him, but that last leg, my arse went again.

‘I’m under pressure in that last leg, Michael’s been there so many times, I’m gutted I lost but there’s plenty more to come.

‘I know I’m playing well but I just need a bit of the rub of the green now and again.’

The former rugby player also took to Twitter to thank the crowd in Leicester after a tetchy relationship with audiences in recent months.

Absolutely gutted to lose tonight but I'm going in the right direction, great game against @MvG180 once again… my time will come and when it does it will be at the most important moment😉 thanks to the crowd this weekend you were very good to me, see you all next week 😘xxxx — Gerwyn Price (@Gezzyprice) October 20, 2019

Price tweeted: ‘Absolutely gutted to lose tonight but I’m going in the right direction, great game against @MvG180 once again… my time will come and when it does it will be at the most important moment😉 thanks to the crowd this weekend you were very good to me, see you all next week 😘xxxx’

This year was Price’s first in the Champions League of Darts so a razor thin loss to the world champion in the semi-finals is an impressive return for the Grand Slam champion.

Van Gerwen goes on to face Peter Wright in the final in Leicester, while Price will return to action at the European Championship which begins in Gottingen, Germany on Thursday.
